docs.snippet: "An unfettered press," says a brilliant American writer, "is the glory of the nation. The ever sounding and resistless vox populi thunders through its columns, to cheer or to subdue, to elevate or to destroy."

headline.main: WHAT NEW-YORK CAN DO.; The War Spirit in the Rural Districts.

docs.snippet: FUNERAL OBSEQUIES OF FATHER CASSIDY.  Nearly forty Catholic priests, and an immense number of the laity, assembled on Saturday at the little church which adjoins the residence of the Catholic pastor of Flatbush, to pay their last tribute of love and...
docs.lead_paragraph: FUNERAL OBSEQUIES OF FATHER CASSIDY. Nearly forty Catholic priests, and an immense number of the laity, assembled on Saturday at the little church which adjoins the residence of the Catholic pastor of Flatbush, to pay their last tribute of love and esteem to their late young and amiable pastor, Father STEPHEN CASSIDY.

headline.main: THE CASE OF DR. SCOTT.; Great Excitement About Calvary Church The Church Flagged Dr. Scott Hung in Effigy His Son Arrested Dr. Scott Resigns. CAUSE OF THE TROUBLE. WERE THE DOCTOR'S SPEECHES CORRECTLY REPORTED? SUNDAY MORNING. THE CHURCH FLAGGED AN EFFIGY OF DR. SCOTT. WHO WAS SHE. AN ODD BLUNDER. THE SERVICES. AFTER CHURCH. YOUNG SCOTT AND MIDDLETON ARRESTED. HOW YOUNG SCOTT CAME TO HAVE THE PISTOL.

docs.snippet: A gentleman from Berlin informs me that intelligence had reached the Point of Rocks to the effect that the enemy's forces, which retreated back to the foot of the mountains and the Shenandoah valley, on the approach of the sickly season along the...

headline.main: THE REBELS AGAIN APPROACHING THE UPPER POTOMAC.

docs.lead_paragraph: A gentleman from Berlin informs me that intelligence had reached the Point of Rocks to the effect that the enemy's forces, which retreated back to the foot of the mountains and the Shenandoah valley, on the approach of the sickly season along the river line, have left their retreats and are now pushing for the Potomac in great numbers.

docs.snippet: Shortly after the flight of Capt. LOVELL, the late Deputy Street-Commissioner, there appeared in several of our morning journals an article copied from a Richmond paper, in which, after announcing that Mr. G.W. SMITH had been rewarded for his treason...

headline.main: The late Street Commissioner, Gustavus W. Smith.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shortly after the flight of Capt. LOVELL, the late Deputy Street-Commissioner, there appeared in several of our morning journals an article copied from a Richmond paper, in which, after announcing that Mr. G.W. SMITH had been rewarded for his treason with the commission of a Major-General in the rebel army, certain comparisons are drawn between him and Gen. McCLELLAN.
